title: Use runtime_data in motionmount integration
body:
## Proposed change
Use the ConfigEntry's runtime_data to store the client object.

## Type of change
- [ ] Dependency upgrade
- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New integration (thank you!)

- [ ] Deprecation (breaking change to happen in the future)

title: Remove the unparsed config flow error from Swiss public transport
body:

<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
the error contained markdown which is not processed at this point, remove it and refer to the step description instead.

title: Call backup listener during setup in onedrive
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

Call the backup listener during `async_setup_entry` to ensure the backup agent is registered correctly and the backup agents actually shows up in the settings.

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?

title: Retry backup uploads in onedrive
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->

Make OneDrive backups less prone to intermittent failures by adding a retry mechanism. For 5xx errors use an exponential backoff strategy. Also catch the correct `TimeoutException` from `httpx`.

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!
  If your PR requires multiple boxes to be checked, you'll most likely need to
  split it into multiple PRs. This makes things easier and faster to code review.

title: VOIP - handle ongoing calls for announce and start conversation
body:
Allow announcements and conversation starts to be queued up for an existing call. Also allow specifying a SIP username for the HA endpoint which is required for some VOIP servers.

I tried to combine elements from the current implementation and my original implementation to handle announcements and conversation start when there is already a call to the specified satellite.

<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
Allow announcements and conversation starts to be queued up for an existing call. Also allow specifying a SIP username for the HA endpoint which is required for some VOIP servers.

I tried to combine elements from the current implementation and my original implementation to handle announcements and conversation start when there is already a call to the specified satellite.

title: Fix error messaging for cascading service calls
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
The caller and callee were inverted which would lead to confusing messages (see https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues/136944#issuecomment-2625405408 ).

title: Consume extra system prompt in first pipeline
body:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->


## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
The `extra_system_prompt` is used to start a conversation, which may have multiple follow-up voice commands. To avoid inserting the prompt over and over, this PR ensures that it is cleared when the first pipeline begins.

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!
  If your PR requires multiple boxes to be checked, you'll most likely need to
  split it into multiple PRs. This makes things easier and faster to code review.
